moves.1. Nf3: I used to play nf3 with (2)b3 to good effect many years ago in the wirral league, so thought i would give it a go against Charleshiggie
moves.1... d5: so the fight for the centre begins...
moves.2. b3: bet he wasn't expecting this? ..on with the plan
moves.2... Bg4: this move was never played against me in all my many years in the league playing this system! however running this game via the chess engines and the top level computers play this very move!!
moves.3. Bb2: naturally i want to own e5 even by blocking in my own dark bishop
moves.3... Nd7: again the choice of the silicone...so my opponents 2 and 3rd move are very popular with computers ...
moves.5. e3: releasing the white bishop and preparing to castle
moves.7. Be2: removing the annoying pin and now looking at e5
moves.9. h3: not the best of moves, perhaps c4 is better?
moves.9... Bh5: keeps his white bishop for now...
moves.10... Re8: perhaps this move is to retreat the black bishop after my c file advance, or to strike at the centre with e5? ..
moves.11. Ne5: cannot allow the e5 push....and looking at playing f4
moves.11... Bxe2: great! one less defender to worry about
moves.12... c5: c5 is played a little too late in my humble opinion
moves.13... b6: was not expecting this move at all..i thought Rc8?
moves.14... Qc7: now development is complete and his rooks are connected.....
moves.15. Rac1: a very natural and useful move ...
moves.15... Re7: so this surely is to double up rooks on the e file and smash the centre?
moves.16. Qf3: prophylaxis and putting my lady to a safer place
moves.19... dxe4: now my g4 move doesnt look so bad..
moves.20. Qg2: slightly better now for me i thinks
moves.20... cxd4: really? wow and now the c file looks alive!
moves.21. Nc6: and suddenly the game takes on a different dimension
moves.22. Nxd4: regaining the material but also eyeing f5
moves.24. Be5: risky move this and could easily backfire..
moves.24... Nd3: what about the c7 square Cahrlie?
moves.25... Qb8: what?? ...now come on how many of you would play this move? ..however the chessking computer programme chooses this move in post match analysis, so again Charles is showing his superior playing ability..
moves.27... Bc5: was not expecting this at all
moves.28. Rxf7: this move had me buzzing all over!
moves.28... Qxe5: king doesn't take the bait, and instead queen takes my little worthless pawn? im now confused as i did not consider this very strange move by my opponent..but again this move is played by the computer in post match?!!
moves.29. Qc4: the only worthy move as not to embarrass my rook on f7..and with a discovered to boot!
moves.31. Rf4: now im a bit dispirited and certain this move does nothing much ..other than retreating my knight to g3 and pressuring the e4 pawn.
moves.31... Rac8: ooopss....now its time to concede and realize my opponent has equalized
moves.32. Qd4: wimped out and a draw agreed......still a very entertaining game.
